channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-15669] LLAP: Improve aging in shortest job first scheduler
item.description: Under high concurrency, some jobs can gets starved for longer time when hive.llap.task.scheduler.locality.delay is set to -1 (infinitely wait for locality).
item.summary: LLAP: Improve aging in shortest job first scheduler

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: rajesh.balamohan/gopalv/sseth can someone please take a look?

ATTACHMENT ID: 12848458 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
prasanth_j - Should the comparison be based on "getFirstAttemptStartTime" as opposed to "getDagStartTime" ?

I am not sure what would be correct delta here. Should it be wrt to dag start time or attempt start time? Don't starve the dag for long time as opposed to don't starve the attempt. My thinking was not starving the dag for a long time.
Not sure why precommit failed. Rebased the patch.

https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12849019/HIVE-15669.1.patch

ATTACHMENT ID: 12849040 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

Had offline discussion with rajesh.balamohan and it makes sense to change the wait to be currentAttemptStartTime - firstAttemptStartTime. If we use dag start time it will introduced artificial aging when there are long running upstream tasks.
rajesh.balamohan can you take another look?
